summary.para: The TRUSTEE structure identifies the user account, group account, or logon session to which an access control entry (ACE) applies. The structure can use a name or a security identifier (SID) to identify the trustee.
Access control functions, such as and, use this structure to identify the logon account associated with the access control or audit control information in an structure.

member.name: TRUSTEE_A.pMultipleTrustee
member.summary: A pointer to a TRUSTEE structure that identifies a server account that can impersonate the user identified by the ptstrName member. This member is not currently supported and must be NULL.

member.name: TRUSTEE_A.MultipleTrusteeOperation
member.summary: A value of the enumeration type. Currently, this member must be NO_MULTIPLE_TRUSTEE.

member.name: TRUSTEE_A.TrusteeForm
member.summary: A value from the enumeration type that indicates the type of data pointed to by the ptstrName member.

member.name: TRUSTEE_A.TrusteeType
member.summary: A value from the enumeration type that indicates whether the trustee is a user account, a group account, or an unknown account type.

summary.para: A pointer to a buffer that identifies the trustee and, optionally, contains information about object-specific ACEs. The type of data depends on the value of the TrusteeForm member.
This member can be one of the following values.

listheader.description: A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the name of the trustee.
A pointer to an structure that contains the name of the trustee and the names of the object types in an object-specific ACE.
A pointer to an structure that contains the SID of the trustee and the GUIDs of the object types in an object-specific ACE.
Pointer to the SID of the trustee.
